channel.title: Technology on Voyager Internet Ltd.
channel.description: Recent content in Technology on Voyager Internet Ltd.

item.title: Voyager establishes a Point of Presence in Sydney
item.description: Voyager has established a new Point of Presence (POP) in Sydney that provides dedicated backhaul to Australia via diverse Trans-Tasman undersea cables, offering high capacity and redundancy to connected services between Australia and New Zealand.

item.title: Voyager Delivers the Message with SMS Text Solution
item.description: From internal staff and emergency communications to engaging with and retaining customers, one of the best ways to get a message across fits right in the palm of your hand.

item.title: Getting the Message: How Businesses Use SMS to Connect with Customers
item.description: We are busy people. Always on the go, with so much on our plates.

item.title: Which smart speakers work best in NZ?
item.description: Currently the Google Nest Mini is widely considered the most capable and functional entry level smart speaker officially available in New Zealand.

item.title: Voyager credited for playing significant role in success of independent information company
item.description: Independent information company Multimedia Investments Ltd (MIL) credits Voyager for playing a significant role in its success

item.title: You've got mail: everything you want to know about spam
item.description: Spam emails have been around as long as commercial internet has been available.

item.title: Voyager completes upgrade of core network
item.description: Voyager Internet has recently completed a 100 Gigabit upgrade of its core data network.

item.title: Is the end nigh for copper phone lines? Don’t lose your voice – consider VoIP for business
item.description: With the successful rollout of Ultra Fast Broadband (UFB) across the country, fibre is becoming accessible to more and more New Zealanders.

item.title: Fibre broadband for business - differences and advantages over DSL
item.description: New Zealand has some of the fastest broadband in the world, as indicated by a 2019 study.
